section: The Customer is responsible for paying the recurring monthly fee in the amount of $450. <*$p$*>The Customer is responsible for paying the recurring monthly fees at their discretion and convenience.
explanation: The first sentence establishes a clear obligation for the customer to pay a monthly fee of $450. However, the second sentence contradicts this by stating the customer can pay at their 'discretion and convenience.' This implies the customer has the option to not pay or to pay whenever they choose, directly conflicting with the obligation to pay a fixed amount monthly. This ambiguity undermines the enforceability of the payment terms.

This effectively negates the initial statement about the $450 monthly fee, creating a legal contradiction.

section: This Agreement shall automatically be renewed for one (1) or more one (1) month periods unless either the Customer or i-on gives notice to the other party of its intention not to renew the Agreement, which notice must be given not less than fifteen (15) days before the end of the respective initial or renewal term. <*$p$*>Either party may terminate this Agreement without cause at any time effective upon fifteen (15) days' written notice.
explanation: The first sentence states that the contract will renew for 'one (1) or more one (1) month periods' unless a 15-day notice is given. The second sentence then states that either party can terminate the agreement at any time with a 15-day notice. This is contradictory because the first sentence implies a renewal period will automatically occur unless notice is given, whereas the second allows for termination at any point, even within a renewal period, effectively negating the purpose of a renewal period.
